string-array.name: tips
string-array.item: "Women’s and men’s brain are different biologically and intellectually."
"Boredom is more a habit formed in brains, and shaped by your choices, than a reality."
"Environment counts, and a healthy setting helps people transform problems into solutions."
"Stronger, more intense emotional connections are linked to memories prompted by scent."
"Dendrite brain cells use the outside world and take shape, or grow based on what you do."
"Music changes brain wave speeds in ways that impact moods and alter productivity."
"Lectures and conversations benefit intelligence of the speaker more than the audience."
"Brain waves can bring either sleep or peak performance, based on how you activate them."
"Hook even difficult facts onto one thing you know and learning increases in less time"
"Multiple intelligences are common to all, used by few, and can be more developed daily."
"The human releases growth hormones during sleep"
"2% of the population has no sense of smell at all."
"Plasticity enables people to rewire the human brain in ways that keep it younger and smarter."
"Stress literally shrinks the brain."
"Inspire creativity and invention through teaching others, at the same time you also learn."
"Create new neuron pathways each time you add a solution to any problem you encounter."
"The weight of the human brain is about 3 lbs."
"Studies show that brain waves are more active while dreaming than when you are awake."
"Your brain uses 20 percent of the blood and oxygen circulating in your body."
"Humans continue to make new neurons throughout life in response to mental activity."
"Every time you recall a memory or have a new thought, you are creating a new connection in your brain."
"The brain is made up of about 75 percent water."
"8 to 10, = the number of seconds you have before losing consciousness due to blood loss."
"You can’t tickle yourself because your brain distinguished between unexpected external touch and your own touch."
"Lack of sleep may actually hurt your ability to create new memories."
"Just because you don’t remember your dreams doesn’t mean you don’t dream. Everyone dreams!"
"The average number of thoughts that humans are believed to experience each day is 70,000."
"12 percent of people dream only in black and white while others dream in color."
"While you sleep at night may be the best time for your brain to consolidate all your memories from the day."
"Excessive stress has shown to alter brain cells, brain structure and brain function."
"Reading aloud and talking often to a young child promotes brain development."
"There are no pain receptors in the brain, so the brain can feel no pain."
"A newborn baby’s brain grows about three times its size in the first year."
"It is thought that a yawn works to send more oxygen to the brain, therefore working to cool it down."
"Memory is formed by associations, so if you want help remembering things, create associations for yourself."
"If you are snoring, you are not dreaming."
"Music lessons have shown to considerably boost brain organization and ability in both children and adults."
"Most people dream about 1 to 2 hours a night and have an average of 4 to 7 dreams each night."
"The brain continues to send out brain waves until approximately 37 hours after death."
"The old adage of humans only using 10percent of their brain is not true. Every part of the brain has a known function."
"The cerebral cortex grows thicker as you learn to use it."
"The human brain is the fattest organ in the body and may consists of at least 60 percent fat."
"The cerebrum is the largest part of the brain and makes up 85 percent of the brain’s weight."
"Your brain consists of about 100 billion neurons."
"There are 100,000 miles of blood vessels in the brain."
"The capacity for such emotions as joy, happiness, fear, and shyness are already developed at birth."
"You can learn more effectively by writing information longhand, not by typing."
"Story telling can be a good way to exercise your brain."
"Meditation reduces your stress levels and improves brain performance."
"A little physical activity and a smart diet will make it much easier for you to keep your brain in top shape."
"The human brain is over three times as big as the brain of other mammals that are of similar body size."
"The human brain is protected by the skull, a protective casing made up of 22 bones that are joined together."
"The brain is suspended in Cerebrospinal fluid, this liquid acts as a cushion to physical impact and a barrier to infections."
"4 to 6, = the number of minutes your brain can survive without oxygen before it starts to die."
"10 to 23, = the number of watts of power your brain generates when you’re awake (that’s enough to turn on a light bulb!)."
"Size doesn’t matter in the brain. There is no evidence that a larger brain is smarter than a smaller brain."
"There are 100,000 miles of blood vessels in the brain. That's enough to wrap around the whole Earth four times!"
"The rate at which your brain processes information can range from 0.5 meters/second (1MPH) to 120 meters/second (268 MPH)."
"Laughing at a joke seems like a simple enough action, but it requires activity in 5 different areas of our brain!"
"High altitude conditions makes the brain see weird visions due to the reduced supply of oxygen."
"The images our eyes receive are actually upside-down. Our brain corrects them, so that we see them the right side-up!"
"When you sneeze all your bodily functions stop, including your heart."
"Your nose can remember 50,000 different scents."
"Nerve impulses to and from the brain travel as fast as 170 miles per an hour."
"Our brain uses 20 percent of our body energy and makes up only 2 percent of our body weight."
"The colder the room you sleep in, the better the chances that you will have a bad dream."
"After eating too much your hearing is less sharp"
"Women were better able to identify citrus, vanilla, cinnamon and coffee smells."
"Vitamin E protects the brain cells from damage caused by alcohol consumption"
"Humans are the only animals to produce emotional tears"
"Right-handed people live, on average, nine years longer than left handed people"
"There are about 1350000 neurons in the human spinal cord"
"The brain is much more active during at night than during the day"
"The average person can fall asleep in 7 minutes"
"Regular exercise, Healthy diet, Mental stimulation, Quality Sleep, Stress management, and an active social life are great for your brain"
"Frequent mental stimulation will reduce the risk of Alzheimer's disease"
"There's a virus that attacks human DNA making people less intelligent, impairing brain activity, learning and memory."
"Alcohol doesn't make you forget anything. When you get blackout drunk, the brain temporarily loses the ability to create memories."
"You have Taste receptors in the stomach, intestines, pancreas, lungs, anus, testicles and the brain."
"The human brain has the same consistency as tofu"
"The smell of chocolate increases brain waves, which triggers relaxation"
"Forgetting is good for the brain: deleting unnecessary information helps the nervous system retain its plasticity."
"One study found that using a mobile phone for a long time significantly increases the risk of brain tumors."
"Sleep deprivation affects the brain in multiple ways that can impair judgment and slow reaction."
"It only takes 6 minutes for brain cells to react to alcohol"
